clinical_study.brief_title: New-Onset Atrial Fibrillation Complicating Myocardial Infarction in ShangHai
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Study on New-Onset Atrial Fibrillation Complicating Myocardial Infarction at Shanghai Tenth People's Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: To characterize and estimate the incidence rate of new-onset atrial fibrillation (NOAF) in patients with acute myocardial infarction (MI). To explore the prognostic implications of NOAF in patients with MI. To further validate the impact of NOAF subtypes, such as time-point of NOAF occurrence, NOAF burden (transient, paroxysmal, and persistent), and frequency (1 episode vs >1 episodes) on clinical outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
In the present study, investigators retrospectively review the medical records of all MI patients who were admitted to the coronary artery unit (CCU) between February 2014 and February 2018.
All eligible patients' demographics, clinical, laboratory, echocardiogram, and angiographic data will be collected. As all patients will receive 24-hour consecutive cardiac monitoring, NOAF incidents presenting during patients' hospital stay will be recorded. Moreover, to comprehensively explore the association between post-MI NOAF and clinical outcomes, investigators also collect data with respect to 1) time-point of NOAF occurrence (<24h, 24-72h, and >72h); 2) NOAF burden (transient, paroxysmal, and persistent); 3) NOAF frequency (1 episode vs >1 episodes).
With the use of multivariable regression models, investigators intend to evaluate the independent role of post-MI NOAF (or its subtypes) in subsequent cardiovascular events.

primary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular death, recurrent myocardial infarction, new-onset NYHA IV heart failure, cardiogenic shock, ventricular tachycardia, and cerebrovascular event

secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of any of the individual components of MACE in the time frame.
Cardiovascular death, recurrent myocardial infarction, new-onset NYHA IV heart failure, cardiogenic shock, ventricular tachycardia, and cerebrovascular event.

arm_group.description: Patients with MI who are free from a medical history of atrial fibrillation (AF) will be recognized as NOAF if they suffer an atrial fibrillation (lasting for at least 30 seconds which are recorded by a 24h cardiac monitoring) incident during hospitalization.
Patients with MI who are free from a medical history of AF will be recognized as Non-NOAF if they persist with sinus rhythm (based on 24h cardiac monitoring records) during hospitalization.

intervention.description: All patients with MI hospitalized in the CCU department of Shanghai Tenth People's Hospital will receive 24-hour cardiac monitoring until discharge.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute MI without a medical history of AF.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients hospitalized for acute MI between February 2014 and February 2018
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with chronic AF;
- Patients undergoing emergent coronary artery bypass surgery.
